column4: Schuffle, is the 127.0.0.2 considered the loopback address for tunnelling?
It seems like a bypass address for the 127.0.0.1 loopback.
FreeNX is a good alternative when you have only small bandwidth
es I have, you must activate remote portforwarding to use it: http://martybugs.net/smoothwall/puttyvnc.cgi
you only need your box and the box yu want to connect to, nothing more
and of course te remote box needs ssh enabled
it was the first hit from google, mybe I should lookup a better example
the important part is that you use remote portforwarding
FreeNX uses ssh by default to connect
aptitude is the recommended way of installing it unites apt-get and apt-cache and has better dependency resolution
Before I install a package I do a aptitude update, just to be sure to have the actual package list
I think I used the default keys
You experience with NX or with seveas?
